intro: Cyclostemon verrucosus, commonly known as the woolly cyclostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in shaded conditions, which contributes to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
